A really well made expansion for an already amazing well known title that is Half-Life. This expansion focuses on Adrian Shepherd, a HECU Corporal and his journey through Black Mesa to eliminate Gordon Freeman. Although it is shorter than base game (4-5 hours average for first timers) it still packs enough content to satisfy your thirst for more Half-Life gameplay and plot. 

Pros:-
->Whole new arsenal of weapons as well as returning ones from original Half-Life.
->Really good side-story.
->New Levels.
->New Enemies and mutated forms (including some previous ones)
->A new way to maneuver the map.
->2 Boss battles.
->Everything else that was good about Half-Life

Cons:-
->Annoying Bugs
->A (kind of) Linear way to defeat final boss, rendering already acquired weapons not of much use.
->Overused enemies towards the end (laser/plasma bolts shooting aliens).
->Mouse Flicker issue (check the guides for a fix).
->Questionable friendly A.I.

Highly recommended for any Half-Life fans out there. It is not recommended to play this before completing original Half-Life or Black Mesa.

Thanks to new weapons, enemys and fun levels the game would be worth a buy. I was able to play for 6 hours until I got pulled into a wall everytime I move through a certain point in a ventilation shaft. This leads me to not being able to progress in the game anymore.

★★★★★ Superb!

[h1]Action[/h1]

A great expansion that manages to hold on it's own without leaning too much on the already successful Half-Life. Gives you a new story line, perfectly supplements the events in Half-Life and throws in some new things that offer a different experience.

Instead of being the protagonist Gordon Freeman, you now take place as an antagonist known as Adrian Shepard, a soldier tasked with hunting down Gordon Freeman while fending of aliens at the same time. It soon turns out that in general chaos everyone fights everyone, including new alien species and black ops soldiers. The story is fantastic, showing a different perspective.

There are a few new weapons (alien lightning gun, Desert Eagle) and some new features. You get to lead other soldiers with various specialties: engineer who can cut doors, medic who can heal you. You learn to climb ropes and at one point you can use alien technology of grappling gun.

Graphics is not great, but it's cool enough and the level design with brilliant color schemes and lighting styles makes up for it.

Overall, this game is a splendid masterpiece and I would recommend anyone buying.

Камон, чё онлайн такой маленький?) Почему людям не нравится? Зайду на сервер со списком 1/16, встречу одного героя (чаще всего АФКшер) и давай рубиться часами, и тут как выйдет, и скучно станет. А лучше пусть выпустят сиквел, как было с HF1 (выпустили HF1 на новом движке, игра называется - Black Mesa) или вторую часть, продолженте отчанянных путешествий капрала военного спецподразделения HECU - Адриана Шепарда. Чтобы сюжет новой части например, пересекался с сюжетом Half-Life 2. Это было бы трындец как круто. Лучше бы вместо новой операции - "Расколотая Сеть" в CS:GO, работали бы над новыми проектами и продолжениями легендарных игр. Называется создали легендарные игры, на их деньги покормили себя, напоили, социальными потребностями себя обеспечили, оделись, денег нафармили и вперёд дорожкой г*вно создавать по пути к Дисней Лэнду. Алё, там, в Сиэтле, очнитесь. Мы геймеры выпускаем вас из стазиса, вы свободны, быстро создавайте HF3, HF: Opposing Force 2, Portal 3, Left 4 Dead 3. Хватит нас поить д*рьмом из кс, хотим нового!

Jó FPS, különálló game-nek is elmegy, elég hosszú.
A Blue Shift-nél több tartalom van benn, fegyverek, ellenfelek.
Két dolog volt benne rettentő idegesítő. 
1) Állandóan 15/100 HP-val kell 6-8 ellenfelet leszedni, akik úgy vannak beprogramozva hogy lát = lő.
2) A végső boss: meg kell sebesíteni, majd mikor gyenge, középen tovább lőni. Pár ilyen kört kell futni, közben mindig lespawnol 1 ellenfelet. Szokásos boss fight séma. Sajnos a sebzés animációját elfelejtették megcsinálni, így nem tudtam hogy jó helyre lövök és vége lesz egyszer, vagy tök felesleges amit csinálok 10-20 perce.

La historia relata los eventos de Half-Life, pero desde la perspectiva del lado opuesto como lo implica el título. Eres el cabo Adrian Shephard. Lo han enviado al Centro de Investigación de Black Mesa para localizar y eliminar a Gordon Freeman. Como en el original, las cosas inmediatamente salen mal, se cometen errores, la gente muere y su plan inicial se reemplaza por una lucha complicada por la supervivencia. Es un testimonio del éxito de Half-Life que su historia realmente merece ser contada nuevamente. Los desarrolladores saben que si bien Adrian Shephard no tiene idea de lo que Freeman está haciendo, tú sí, y empaquetan el juego con pistas sobre dónde estás en relación con el héroe de Half-Life. Su camino inicialmente converge con el de Freeman, luego toma algunos desvíos inesperados.

Al igual que Half-Life, la mayor fortaleza de Opposing Force es su éxito en brindar sorpresas constantemente. Puedes sentir el entusiasmo de los diseñadores a medida que se desarrolla una escena memorable tras otra, y te obliga a seguir jugando. Aunque Opposing Force solo tiene un tercio de su predecesor, está repleto de contenido original. No hay mucho relleno en el juego, por lo que si bien puedes terminarlo en poco más de 3 horas, la experiencia se siente mucho más completa y satisfactoria que muchos juegos más largos, que tienden a completarse con horas de tiroteos terriblemente similares.

I wrote a review for Half-Life Source, and most of what I said there applies here as well. The key differences between standard Half-Life and Opposing Force is the campaign. I found it to be weaker in Opposing Force, but still very good. The campaign was however definitely a lot shorter as my playtime for this game is less than half of standard Half-Life's. Overall though if you want the complete story give this game a play it was a good time.

8/10
